question: Which of the following represents Charles' law?
option1: Volume x Temperature = constant when Pressure is constant
option2: Volume/Temperature = constant when Pressure is constant
option3: Temperature = Volume when Pressure is constant
answer: Volume/Temperature = constant when Pressure is constant
explanation: When the pressure is held constant, the volume of a quantity of the gas is related to the temperature as V/T = constant. This relationship is known as Charlesâ€™ law.
